communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., we hereby request the following records:

Complete FOIA logs for the following years:

-2020
-2021
-2022
-2023

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, we would be grateful if you would inform us of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. We would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. We look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Niles Coalition

title: Emails Regarding Ordinance Targeting Asylum Seekers in Niles

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., we hereby request the following records:

On Tuesday January 23, 2024 during the Village of Niles board meeting, the agenda included an ordinance under new business (item 12a)[1] that in the words of a public commenter is meant to "run migrants out of town".

The public commenter references the discriminatory nature of this policy by referencing a quote by police chief Luis Tigera[2]. After his comment, the Village of Niles Board President George Alpogianis responded:

“Thank you. I know I don't respond to things, but I will respond to this. When we start taking care of our veterans first and getting them out of their tents. All the homeless veterans that we have damn right we'll help anybody. We've got to help our own people first … our veterans. Thank you. “[3]

The board went on to approve this ordinance with no discussion or further comment.[4]

To that effect we are seeking emails from village of Niles email addresses between November 1, 2023 and the date this request is processed (inclusive of those dates) that include any of the following keywords in the subject line and/or body:

– "migrant"
– "asylum"
– "immigrant"
– "refugee"
– "unscheduled bus stop"

Please include any email attachments.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, we would be grateful if you would inform us of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. We would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter.  We look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Niles Coalition

 - CITATIONS - 
[1]"ORDINANCE 2024-xx - Ordinance Adding Chapter 98 Traffic and Vehicles, Article V. Standing, Stopping and Parking, Division 1. Generally, Sec. 98-167 Regulation of Unscheduled Bus Stops to the Niles Code of Ordinances"
<https://web.archive.org/web/20240124165320/https://d3n9y02raazwpg.cloudfront.net/niles/9cc58e1a-7d99-11ee-852f-0050569183fa-c24709d9-0e32-4573-adf3-7dc4100ecd8c-1705708299.pdf>

[2]Journal & Topics - Niles Public Safety Committee Recommends Migrant Bus Ordinance
"At Monday’s meeting, Police Chief Luis Tigera said the ordinance is not aimed at tour groups, sports teams, or others chartering a bus, which may be from outside of Cook County or the state who make an unscheduled stop, diverted from another destination to stay in Niles. He said if an officer stopping a bus saw evidence of that, they would not enforce the ordinance. "
<https://web.archive.org/web/20240125171059/https://www.journal-topics.com/articles/niles-public-safety-committee-to-discuss-possible-migrant-bus-ordinance>

[3]Board of Trustees Regular Meeting Tuesday, January 23, 2024 - public commenter on item 12a
<https://play.champds.com/nilesil/event/249/s/3266>

[4]Board of Trustees Regular Meeting Tuesday, January 23, 2024 - approval of item 12a 
<https://play.champds.com/nilesil/event/249/s/3753>

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All probate records for Miriam P Goodman, case number 00-P-1287-01, from 1892, including but not limited to probate estate and property records.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Katie King

title: Office of Naval research list of research contracts for 1972-1979

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Office of Naval research list of research contracts for 1972-1979
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Good afternoon I would like a list of research contracts sponsored by the Office of Naval research for the years 1972 to 1979.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

tim kraemer

title: Airships as Naval ASW Surveillance Platforms report

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Airships as Naval ASW Surveillance Platforms report
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Good afternoon. I would like to obtain a copy of the following report:

Airships as Naval ASW Surveillance Platforms. Naval Underwater Systems Center, Newport R.I. May 1975.

NUSC-TR-4742

ADC002039

authors:

L.E. Mellburg

R.T. Kobayashi

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

tim kraemer
